screensframework

Class CustHomeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • screensframework.CustHomeController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable, ControlledScreen, CustToolbar

    public class CustHomeController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, ControlledScreen, CustToolbar
    FXML Controller class for the Customer Homepage. This page contains selectors that allow the Customer to see all movies playing on a certain date, and then all times that the specified movie is playing on this date. Further, it provides a weekly snapshot of movies, so that the Customer can speedily select a film to watch that is playing over the next few days.
    Author:
    Mark Backhouse

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFilmList()
                                             throws java.io.IOException

        Returns:
        the list of films that are playing on a specified date.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the database file cannot be found.

      • getTimesList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTimesList()
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Uses the DatePicker and film values to find the associated list of available times.
        Returns:
        A list of times for a given date and film.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the database file cannot be found.

      • setFilmList

        private void setFilmList(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the films list after a date has been selected. Films are those that will be showing on the specified date.
        Parameters:
        event - the date has been selected.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the database file cannot be found.

      • setTimesList

        private void setTimesList(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the times list after a date and film have been selected. Times are those that will be showing for the specified date and film.
        Parameters:
        event - the film and date have been selected.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the database file cannot be found.

      • goToCustBookFilmPage

        public void goToCustBookFilmPage(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                          throws java.text.ParseException
        Sends the Customer, along with User, Listing and Booking objects, to the Booking page.
        Parameters:
        event - the Customer clicks the "GO!" button after a selection has been made.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the date value cannot be parsed to the database's format.

      • isValidListingSelection

        private java.lang.Boolean isValidListingSelection(java.lang.String date,
                                                  java.lang.String movie,
                                                  java.lang.String time)
                                           throws java.text.ParseException
        Checks whether a selected listing was valid. Listings are only valid if they have not yet taken place.
        Parameters:
        date - the date of the listing.
        movie - the title of the listing.
        time - the time of the listing.
        Returns:
        true if the listing is taking place in the future, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the input date cannot be converted into a format recognised by the database.
